channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No sign to explain to drivers to give way to pedestrians AND cyclists, 9th June
item.description:
There is a parallel crossing here which prioritises pedestrians AND cyclists to cross and gives them right of way over cars. Cars must stop legally yet many cars do not seem to realise this and drive through the crossing when there are no pedestrians and 'only' bikes waiting to cross or already on the crossing. To combat driver unawareness please can a sign be erected that reminds drivers to give way to pedestrians and cyclists. I have seen similar signs elsewhere, which should not be needed if people know the road rules but since they don't it seems to be needed to avoid an accident. Children also cross on their bikes here and cars should know to always look out for this and to stop if there are cyclists trying to cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rodney Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
